Hello there, I'm Taerom Fuiruim, a blacksmith of some renown.
An interesting piece o' material you got there. Ankheg, if I'm not mistaken. Been a while since I seen the like, but if I remember correctly, it makes a fine set of armor. If properly treated it's comparable to full plate with half the weight!
If you're willing to part with your shells I'll give you 500 gold for the lot of them. No more can I offer with business as slow as it is.
Iron shortage hurting us all.

description:
I've discovered the whereabouts of a set of ancient rings of Blood Magic: the Ring of the Erudite in Swindler's Den and the Ring of the Beast in Cragwallow Slope. They belong among our kind, not gathering mold in some vagabond's treasure pile.
The rings increase the abilities of your vampiric powers. Some say Molag Bal himself gave these rings to ancient powerful vampire lords. Some say that is just a myth.
You'll be able to keep the rings. I wouldn't be telling you where to find them if I desired them for myself.

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: Set Aerie Free
objective: free Aerie
first_tasks: get the key to Aerie's chains from commoners

first_task_locations.description: in the north side of this chamber

reward.description: Aerie might be able to help the player

tools: Aerie works in the circus with Quayle
there's an illusion that makes Aerie look like a monster
Aerie has been chained: the key to her chains looks like a sword
the commoners have the key
Aerie regains her normal form after becoming free
description:
M-my name is Aerie. I... work in the circus with my uncle, Quayle... I... I'm not a monster! I'm an elf, a winged elf... or at least I was... This... this covering you see is some kind of illusion, but if you believe in it, then it becomes real! P-please believe me! Now go before something happens to you, I beg of you!
If... if you're not going to flee, then maybe you can help free me from the chains that keep me bound in this form — and then maybe I can help you!
You... you need the key to these chains. But... but it won't look like a key! There are a couple of... commoners... in the north side of this chamber...
Don't be fooled by the illusion, though... they are monsters! They have a sword which is actually my key... if you get it from them, I can remove the chain and regain my normal form!
But please be careful! You... you can't trust anything you see here!

characters.name: Quayle
characters.description: Aerie's uncle

description:
No! Go away! Please don't kill me...
Illagers are making me scared enough already! Perhaps you'd like to do something villainous, and even net a reward for it?
This village, Fishing Hamlet, has been threatened by nearby Illagers of Deepwood Tower for some time. You could go to their tower in the woods and steal their plans.
Bring the plans to me, and I'll give you an enchanted sword as a reward. Just don't test its blade on me, please!
title: Minecraft

name: Robber's Stash
objective: find the bandit leader's stash by the old tree stump
first_tasks: go to the island to the south and find the old tree stump

quest_giver.description: the bandit leader, a paranoid man, giving quest via "Bandit Leader's Journal"

reward.description: the bandit leader's stash

tools: the bandit leader thinks that his men are going to mutiny: Herd and Brodir are leading their own cliques within the bandits
the bandit leader is going to gather up gold and escape downriver to Dragon Bridge
description:
Bandit Leader's Journal

5th of First Seed, 4E 201
Idiots! Brodir and Herd were at each others' throats again today, and nearly came to blows. The whole camp is on edge. I've ordered an extra ration of mead, but unless this fighting stops, we'll tear ourselves apart.

11th of First Seed, 4E 201
Rumor is that Herd's gathering followers for a mutiny. Brodir's not stupid; he's probably doing the same, just for insurance. I'd kill them both myself, but the camp's split right down the middle. If I tried, there'd be a knife in my back within a week.
I can't take this anymore. I've begun skimming a little gold from the take, bringing it down here when I can. If I can scrape enough together, I'll make a run for it, head downriver to Dragon Bridge.

28th of First Seed, 4E 201
Brodir's getting suspicious -- I caught him poking around in the cove this afternoon. I don't think he found my stash, but it's not safe here. I took the boat out tonight and stowed it on the island to the south, by the old tree stump.
Had a good haul this week. Another caravan or two and I can finally get out of here, and not a moment too soon.

items.name: "Bandit Leader's Journal"
items.description: a journal written by the bandit leader

characters.name: Herd
characters.description: a male bandit in the bandit leader's gang, hates Brodir

characters.name: Brodir

name: Assassin at Large
objective: kill the Khajiit who wants to assassinate Malborn
first_tasks: find the Khajiit

first_task_locations.description: around the main gate of Windhelm

tools: the player saved Malborn from the Thalmor in the past
Malborn could not leave Windhelm for Morrowind because of the Khajiit
description:
Oh, it's you. I didn't expect to see you again.
I'm trying to stay alive. I think time's running out though. I'm pretty sure the Thalmor know where I am. Maybe you can help me.
I was trying to get to Morrowind. The Dunmer don't care much for the Thalmor and I figured I'd be safe there. As safe as anywhere, that is. But there's a Khajiit hanging around the main gate. I didn't like the way he was looking at me. I'm sure he's Thalmor. Just waiting for me to leave Windhelm so he can follow me and kill me in a lonely place.
You'd be saving my life. Again. I know I probably seemed ungrateful... I've just been so scared. Expecting a knife at my throat any minute.

characters.name: Khajiit
characters.description: a suspected male Thalmor assassin
characters.location: around the main gate of Windhelm

Sorry, the Redbelly Mine's dry right now. What's wrong with the mine, you might ask. It's full of spiders, that's what's wrong with it!
Almost killed Grogmar and me when they showed up. I'm worried that they'll come out of the mine looking for food soon... then we're in even bigger trouble.
You'd  clear them out for us? Tell you what. Keep to your word, and I'll line your pockets with as much as I can scrape up.

description:
I'm planning all sorts of new pranks that would make me a famous man here in the village. There's one integral item that I haven't been able to obtain: an Ender Chest. You know, the chests whose contents are stored separately for everyone?
I heard you can find Ender Chests in End Cities at the end of time and space. It should also be possible to craft them somehow. Can you obtain an Ender Chest? I would pay you well for one: you could have some powered rails that I used in one of my pranks.

title: Minecraft

name: Mixed Feelings
objective: recover Ardaline's mage's staff
first_tasks: charm Varon Vamori and make him tell you where Ardaline's mage's staff is

quest_giver.name: Kud-Ei
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Mages Guild

reward.description: recommendation from Kud-Ei

tools: the player asked a recommendation from Kud-Ei
Varon Vamori stole Ardaline's mage's staff
Kud-Ei gives the player a scroll with a powerful Illusion charm spell
description:
I'm afraid I haven't had time to prepare anything conventional for your recommendation. I'm very preoccupied with this situation concerning Ardaline.
Perhaps you can help with that, however. I can't directly get involved, for fear of embarrassing the poor girl. Varon Vamori's been bothering Ardaline every day for a while now. He even stole her Mages' Staff! Perhaps he thinks it's amusing; I don't know. But it needs to stop. It's making her miserable.
I'll need you to have a little chat with Varon Vamori to get Ardaline's staff back, and you can learn something about the power of Illusion in the process. Take this charm scroll. With it, you should find Varon more receptive to questioning.
Don't come back without that staff. I'll write you a recommendation for your help.

characters.description: a female mage who is bullied by Varon Vamori

title: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

name: Separated at Birth
objective: investigate the rumors about another Reynald Jemane in Cheydinhal
first_tasks: find the person whose impersonating Reynald Jemane and tell him to stop

quest_giver.name: Reynald Jemane
quest_giver.description: an annoyed man, drinking his sorrows away

reward.description: gold pieces

tools: Reynald Jemane has never been to Cheydinhal
description:
If I've told you once, I've told you a thousand times. I've NEVER been to Cheydinhal! I... oh, hang on. You're someone else. Apologies, my good friend, I mistook you for someone else. Always being asked about it, I am. 'Didn't I see you in Cheydinhal?', they say. Well I'm sick of it. Sick and tired, tired and sick. And perhaps a little drunk. But never mind. You look like the honest sort, so I've a job for you.
You're going to travel to Cheydinhal, and find out what sort of impostor is trying to besmirch my good name. And you're going to tell him... *hic*... You're going to tell him I am quite capable of besmirching my good name on my own. He should cease and desist immediately. There's fifty gold pieces in it for you, friend...
title: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

name: Magely Mischief
objective: find J'skar, and make him re-appear
first_tasks: talk to the mages about J'skar's disappearance

first_task_locations.description: Bruma Mages Guild, one of the guild halls of the Mages Guild

quest_giver.name: Jeanne Frasoric
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Mages Guild

if someone from the Council were to visit Bruma Mages Guild, and find out that J'skar has vanished, it would look bad on Jeanne Frasoric
Volanaro thinks J'skar's spell backfired
description:
A recommendation, from me? Well, of course. Raminus would naturally want my opinion, wouldn't he?
This is a situation we can both benefit from, Associate. You do me a small favor, and I'll happily send along a glowing recommendation.
J'skar's disappeared. I mean he's really disappeared. No one here has seen him in days. Volanaro thinks maybe a spell backfired. If someone from the Council were to stop by, and find him gone, it'd look bad for me. I can't have that. Talk to the mages here, and see what you can find out.
If you can make J'skar re-appear, you'll have your recommendation.

description:
Thanks... I wasn't sure I'd make it off this farm alive. I wish I could have said the same for my man here.
Some of the Redoran Guard have taken to calling them "ash spawn". Me? I don't care what they're called... all I know is they're a danger to Raven Rock and they need to be stopped.
I was going to search for clues that might lead me to wherever they're coming from. I know it isn't the best place to start, but we know they've been coming from this direction.
Could you lend me a hand? We were searching the farm when the ash spawn ambushed us. Have a look around and see if you can turn up anything useful.

name: A Plot Revealed
objective: find out why Jeanne Frasoric has stopped correspondence with Arch-Mage Traven
first_tasks: find out if Jeanne Frasoric is all right, and let Arch-Mage Traven know if she needs anything

quest_giver.name: Arch-Mage Traven
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Mages Guild

tools: NONE
description:
I am unable to look into something that has been brought to my attention. Are you capable of going on my behalf?
Please go to the Bruma Mages Guild; I have not heard from Jeanne Frasoric for a few days now, which is unusual for her. While I welcome the break from correspondence with her, I worry that something may be amiss, given recent developments.
Find out if Jeanne is all right, and let me know if she needs anything.

characters.name: Jeanne Frasoric
characters.description: a female mage who leads the Bruma Mages Guild, and constantly sends letters to Arch-Mage Traven

title: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

name: Rise in the East
objective: help Orthus Endario prove that the Shatter-Shields are in league with pirates
first_tasks: steal Suvaris Atheron's logbook and bring it to Orthus Endario

quest_giver.name: Orthus Endario
quest_giver.description: an employee of the East Empire Company
quest_giver.location: East Empire Company's rundown offices in Windhelm

tools: pirates have been raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell: the East Empire Company's security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in the war
description:
Sad, isn't it? We can't afford to keep the place running since these attacks started. Pirates, you see. Raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell.
Our own security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in this ridiculous war. We don't even know their base of operations, and attacking single ships won't really solve the problem.
Only the Shatter-Shields appear safe. They are a very powerful family here in Windhelm. They run a private shipping operation, and would love to have the docks to themselves. Wouldn't surprise me if they were in league with the pirates, somehow.
Not yet, no. But perhaps an intrepid person such as yourself could help with that. They have a dark elf who oversees their operations. Suvaris Atheron. She's meticulous to a fault, and keeps a logbook with every transaction she makes.
If you get me the logbook, I'll have proof of Shatter-Shield's treachery.

characters.name: Suvaris Atheron
characters.description: a female dark elf, and the meticulous overseer of the Shatter-Shields' shipping operation

groups.name: Shatter-Shields
groups.description: a powerful family in Windhelm that run a private shipping operation at the docks

objective: purchase Rosethorn Hall
first_tasks: give 25,000 septims to Shum gro-Yarug

reward.name: Rosethorn Hall
reward.description: a large manor house in Skingrad, just inside the main gate, near the bridge to the chapel

tools: the player told Shum gro-Yarug that they want to buy a house
Rosethorn Hall is currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius
Shum gro-Yarug will have Vandorallen Trebatius evicted from Rosethorn Hall
description:
I'm Shum gro-Yarug, the Count's butler.
So you want to buy a house? I can speak for the Count. Rosethorn Hall is a stately manor currently occupied by Vandorallen Trebatius. You won't find a better property for sale in Skingrad. It's just inside the main gate, near the bridge to the chapel.
The house costs 25,000 septims. Give me the septims, and I will order the deed to the house drawn up.
Don't worry about Vandorallen Trebatius. I'll have him evicted. I'm sure he'll find another home easily.

characters.name: Vandorallen Trebatius
characters.description: a man

title: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

name: Evil in Waiting
objective: help Valdar defeat Hevnoraak before he awakens
first_tasks: collect the three vessels needed to vanquish Hevnoraak, and bring them to Valdar

quest_giver.name: Valdar
quest_giver.description: a ghostly guardian whose powers are fading

tools: Valdar has been holding Hevnoraak in his tomb
Hevnoraak's minions guard the three vessels
description:
Leave, stranger. Evil stirs in this place. I fear for the security of the very land if it should break free.
We stand at the tomb of Hevnoraak, who has been dead for many generations. I fear, however, that his return may be at hand. I have been holding him here. While he regains strength, however, I am fading. By now I can barely contain his power, much less defeat him if he awakens. But with the help of a living champion I may be able to succeed.
Three vessels in the tomb below hold the power to vanquish Hevnoraak. Before anything else, we need those. Bring them to me - but be careful, mortal. They are guarded by Hevnoraak's minions. They will stop at nothing to see their master return.

characters.name: Hevnoraak
characters.description: an evil man who has been dead for many generations

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: Smooth Jazbay
objective: collect 20 Jazbay Grapes for  Avrusa Sarethi so that she can cultivate her supply of Nirnroot
first_tasks: find 20 Jazbay Grapes

reward.description: something for the player's efforts

tools: Avrusa Sarethi is keeping a a tight rein on Aduri
description:
Sigh. I've got my hands full here. Between the farm chores, cultivating my supply of Nirnroot and keeping a tight rein on my sister Aduri, there's little time for rest.
Could you help me? One of the ingredients I need to cultivate Nirnroot are Jazbay Grapes... the acidic content of the juice is perfect for the soil. I need twenty of them for my current crop.
I'll give you something for your efforts... finding all of them might not be easy... or cheap.

characters.name: Aduri
characters.description: Avrusa Sarethi's younger sister

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: With Friends Like These...
objective: kill one of the kidnapped people for the Dark brotherhood
first_tasks: turn around, and select the person who shall not leave the room alive

quest_giver.name: Astrid
quest_giver.description: the player's admirer, and a member of the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: the player's debt to the Dark Brotherhood will be paid

tools: Astrid woke the player up from their sleep
Aventus Aretino was looking for the Dark Brotherhood: Grelod the Kind was a Dark Brotherhood contract, and the player must pay for killing her
description:
Sleep well? Who I am really isn't as important as what I am. And what I am is an admirer. Of sorts.
You see, that little Aretino boy was looking for the Dark Brotherhood. For me, and my associates. Grelod the Kind was, by all rights, a Dark Brotherhood contract. A kill... that you stole. A kill you must repay.
If you turn around, you'll notice my guests. I've "collected" them from... well, that's not really important. The here and now. That's what matters. You see, there's a contract out on one of them, and that person can't leave this room alive. But... which one? Go on, see if you can figure it out.
Make your choice. Make your kill. I just want to observe... and admire.

characters.name: Aventus Aretino
characters.description: a young boy who wanted Grelod the Kind dead

characters.name: Grelod the Kind
characters.description: a cruel, old female orphanage headmistress, killed by the player

Gulum-Ei is our inside man at the East Empire Company in Solitude. I'm betting he acted as a go-between for the sale of Goldenglow Estate and that he can finger our buyer.

objective: retrieve Dravin Llanith's stolen bow
first_tasks: find the thieves who stole Dravin Llanith's bow

reward.description: Dravin Llanith will pay the player what he can

tools: NONE
description:
A few days ago, some thieves from Riften broke in here and stole it! Can you imagine? Took the only thing of value we had. It was a family heirloom. I can't even put a price on how much that thing means to me.
I'm sure that they are from Riften. I bumped into them when I was coming back to my farm after buying supplies. I know those lowlifes took it with them back to the Ratway. They left an unmistakable stench behind.
If you have the guts to head into the Ratway and get my bow back, I'll pay you what I can. It would be nice to have it back... means a lot to me.

title: Fallout 2

name: Dragon Research
objective: help Esbern complete his research on dragons
first_tasks: bring Esbern dragon scales and bones

reward.description: a potion made out of dragon scales and bones

tools: NONE
description:
I need to finish my research on dragons.
While you're out hunting dragons, keep a sharp eye open for any dragon scales and bones you might find. I'd be interested in looking at them.
Have you ever heard of the expression, "the scale of the lizard that bit you?" No, I guess not. Well, the principle applies here. I'll make you a potion, made from those dragon parts.
title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: The Eye of Magnus
objective: force Ancano stop exploiting the Eye of Magnus

quest_giver.name: Tolfdir
quest_giver.description: the player's teacher at the College of Winterhold

tools: Tolfdir and the others can't crack Ancano's magical shield around the College of Winterhold
the player got the Staff of Magnus the Labyrinthian
description:
Ancano has sealed himself inside the College! The Eye of Magnus is is growing his power. We can't crack whatever magic he's using to shield himself.
I hope your trip to Labyrinthian was worth it. You have the Staff of Magnus, then? Let's hope it's as powerful as the Psijics believe it to be.
You're the one with the staff, my child. If it can help us get inside the College, and reach Ancano, we'll have to hope that there's a way to stop all this.

items.name: Staff of Magnus
items.description: a powerful staff that can breach magical shields according to the Psijics

characters.description: a power-hungry male wizard

the temple of Talos hired Travin to steal a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple
description:
It's Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos.
I have a chore for you that may prove interesting.
This is not a matter of negotiation or exploration. No, now you are to face true enemies of Talos.
Slanderous words have been said. Things did not go well for Stormherald Nallabir at this past tenday's theological debate in the Government District. The growing arrogance of the Lathanderian church is distasteful. Talos should be feared; their irreverence is insulting.
We have hired a thief, and he has stolen a Dawn Ring from the Lathanderian temple.
Find Travin in the slums at night, collect the ring, and return it here.
Remember that the honor of Talos rests upon your shoulders.

characters.description: the evil god of thunder and destruction

first_tasks: find the hobgoblins who stole Zhurlong's Boots of Stealth

first_task_locations.description: the badlands to the south of Beregost

reward.description: gold pieces

tools: NONE
description:
Hey, I'm Zhurlong! What is a thief to do, huh? You invest in some Boots of Stealth, you set up shop in the badlands to the south of Beregost and then, WHAM... Along comes a tribe of hobgoblins and they tear the boots from right off your feet!
Damn-blasted hobgoblin bullies... I'll pay you 100 gold pieces to show them who's boss and get those boots back...
title: Baldur's Gate

name: On to Grunnheim!
objective: defeat the Dark Alchemist before he gets to the Clockwork Core
first_tasks: speak to the Railmaster, and depart to Grunnheim

reward.name: Clockwork Core

the Dark Alchemist is powerful enough to destroy the barrier between the player's world and the realm of the Netherim
description:
Let us return to the matter of the Dark Alchemist. He has now stolen the energy of three Guardians, and we thought he desired my power as well. But, for some reason, he has left the desert, and is now en route to Grunnheim.
That can only mean that he is bound for the Clockwork Core. With the power he has amassed, he could destroy the barrier between our world and the realm of the Netherim. They would pour through by the millions.
Seek the Railmaster, and depart for Grunnheim as soon as you are able.

title: Torchlight II

name: Enter the Door
objective: recover the Crown from Thiss, and bring it to Robot Eye
first_tasks: find Thiss

quest_giver.name: Robot Eye
quest_giver.description: an arrogant person guarding the door

reward.description: the player will be allowed through the door

tools: the player told Robot Eye that the player wants to go through the door
description:
You want through THIS door? Ha! Well, it's not as simple as that. Everything has a price - you must know that by now.
If you can solve a problem for us, we will solve a problem for you by letting you through the door. Thiss, the great Spectral Dragon, has kept something of ours for many long years. We would like it back - and you will get it for us, oh yes.
There is a Crown, a... family heirloom that he stole from us. He will not give it up easily, of course. But this door is im-PENETRABLE - so you've got a much better chance with Thiss than you do waiting around here.
You can find Thiss in the Forgotten Halls... good luck! You're going to need it.

characters.name: Thiss
characters.description: a great spectral dragon who stole the Crown from Robot Eye

name: The Way of the Voice
objective: answer the summons of the Greybeards
first_tasks: reach High Hrothgar

first_task_locations.description: hight up the slopes of the Throat of the World

reward.description: the Greybeards can teach the player how to use their gift

tools: the player killed a dragon for Balgruuf the Greater and absorbed some kind of power from it
the Greybeards think that the player is a Dragonborn: a Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the voice - the ability to focus the player's vital essence into a Thu'um, or shout
description:
So when the dragon died, you absorbed some kind of power from it. So it's true. The Greybeards really were summoning you. They are masters of the Way of the Voice. They live in seclusion high on the slopes of the Throat of the World.
Whatever happened when you killed that dragon, it revealed something in you, and the Greybeards heard it. If they think you're Dragonborn, who are we to argue?
The Dragonborn is said to be uniquely gifted in the Voice - the ability to focus your vital essence into a Thu'um, or Shout. If you really are Dragonborn, they can teach you how to use your gift.
You'd better get up to High Hrothgar immediately. There's no refusing the summons of the Greybeards. It's a tremendous honor.

groups.description: masters of the way of the voice

locations.name: High Hrothgar
locations.description: the secluded home of the Greybeards

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: Lights Out!
objective: help run the Icerunner aground
first_tasks: put out the lighthouse fire
meet Jaree-Ra

reward.description: loot from the Icerunner

tools: Jaree-Ra and Deeja collect things nobody misses
with the war, many more ships come through Solitude Docks loaded with weapons and pay, but few people
description:
It's easy to find things to sell. Things nobody will miss. Things from underground, or just left lying around in someone's house. I bet the two of us, we're very alike. So why not take the next step? We can help each other.
My sister Deeja and I are treasure hunters. You could be too. We like to collect things. We are not thieves. We just take what will not be missed. What no one needs anymore. Maybe we take some weapons and stop a few deaths. Who would call that thievery?
With the war, many more ships come through these docks. Loaded with weapons and pay, but few people. And they pass through dangerous waters. We have an interest in one of those boats, the Icerunner. The Solitude Lighthouse will be guiding it in... but if its fire were to go out, the Icerunner would run aground.
If someone were to put out the lighthouse fire and then meet me on the docks afterwards... I could certainly direct them to that loot. That someone could be you.

characters.name: Deeja
characters.description: Jaree-Ra's sister, a female treasure hunter

You could take word to her in Solitude that there'll be a shipment soon. Buy us some time and keep her off our backs. In exchange, I'm willing to let a few ingots go missing. Maybe more than a few.
You'd do me quite a favor. I wouldn't forget it. I'm sure she'll be angry. Brace yourself.

tools: suspicious stew is mushroom stew laced with some flowers: it may have positive or negative effects on its eater
description:
I keep the villagers fed. Without my crops, our village would surely face a famine!
Sometimes, I like to cook new foods using various natural ingredients to prepare us for poor harvests. This time, I tried to make some mushroom stew, but one of the villagers accidentally tripped, and dropped some flowers into the pot with the stew.
Traveler, could you please taste the suspicious mushroom stew? It can have either positive or negative effects on its eater. I'm giving you some.
Please see what happens after eating the suspicious stew, and report back to me. I'd hate to throw away the whole batch of mushroom stew for nothing. I'll even give you 10 emeralds for being a taster.

You can have this scroll Daddy gave me, if you find Pixie. I can't read the words yet anyways.

Oh, the world of books... I have heard that a new copy of that wondrous tome, "The History of the Fateful Coin," can be had for a pretty penny in one of the stores around here. If you would be so kind as to buy it for an old man like myself, I'd gladly reimburse you.
I'd even give you a little bonus to help in your travels, a book called "History of the Dead Three".

Training? Oh, I'm afraid that's not my area of expertise. I'm very focused on wines right now, you see.
Wonderful thing, wine. It's all about the balance. The flavor, the bouquet, the consistency... just wonderful. I'm sorry, what? Training... right. I'll make you a deal: you fetch me a bottle of each of the best wines from Skingrad, and I'll think about it.
Both vineyards, Tamika's and Surilie Brothers. Vintage 399. Oh, what a good year that was...

Poor Giruad Gemane at the Bards College has been waiting for my latest work, "Olaf and the Dragon," for weeks now. Roads are a mess.
You'll deliver the book for me? You're sure? When you see Giruad, ask for a tip. I'm sure he'll be in a good mood after reading this.

You must defeat the Alchemist and seize the Heart. He intends to use it for destruction, but, infused with the energy stolen from the Guardians, it now has the power to restore the Clockwork Core, and repair the damage to the barrier.

quest_giver.description: a fellow member of the Thieves Guild

tools: the player showed a Stone of Barenziah to Vex for appraisal
description:
Been a while since I've seen one of those. What you've got there is a Stone of Barenziah. The stone was pried off of Barenziah's ceremonial crown by a thief in order to cover his tracks.
I think there were twenty-four in all; supposedly, all of them are in Skyrim. Most people keep them as a curiosity. Some of the Guild members have tried to locate them over the years, but they haven't been successful... well, until now.
I only buy things I can turn around quickly for a profit. And no one wants those stones unless they have the whole set. Tell you what, if you find the rest of them, talk to me again. Otherwise, keep it and maybe it'll bring you luck.

first_tasks: kill 3 Spriggans with Valdr
tools: Valdr, Ari and Niels tracked a bear to Moss Mother Cavern: Spriggans appeared and killed Ari and Niels
description:
Name's Valdr. I hunt out of Falkreath.
We tracked a bear to this den, Moss Mother Cavern. Good coin for those pelts. We had the big sow cornered when they showed up. Three of them, out of nowhere. Spriggans.
Niels went down before we even knew to run. Ari died just inside. I never even thought the things were real. But now what? I can't just walk away. Not with my friends' bodies in there, being torn apart by those beasts.
You would help me clear out the Spriggans? You'd do that for a stranger? I don't know what to say. Lead on, I suppose.

While you were gone, I sent a messenger to High Chancellor Ocato. He waits for us in the Imperial City.
Chancellor Ocato is the head of the Elder Council. The Council rules in the Emperor's absence. I don't expect any objections from the Elder Council, but we should defer to their authority.
Let's go to the Imperial City at once, before the enemy can recover from Mankar Camoran's death. Until we light the Dragonfires, the Gates are open, and Mehrunes Dagon's invasion continues.

title: Fallout

name: Lifting the Vale
objective: bring the Draconian Madstone to Countess Narina Carvain
first_tasks: find the Draconian Madstone

reward.description: an Akaviri artifact

tools: the player has seen Akaviri relics displayed by Countess Narina Carvain
Countess Narina Carvain gives the player a translation of an Akaviri messenger's translated diary, a rough map and a unique key that may help the player in the ruins in Pale Pass
description:
Allow me to formally introduce myself. I'm Countess Narina Carvain. I assume you've noticed all of the Akaviri relics I'm displaying.
Well, it's safe to say I'm a collector of sorts. I've invested a great deal of time and money acquiring these bits of ancient history. In fact, I'd be so bold as to proclaim my collection the most complete in all Cyrodiil; perhaps even beyond. Except for one thing.
A particular relic has eluded me for many years. Possessing this piece of Akaviri antiquity would make my collection complete. I'm of course referring to The Draconian Madstone. The stone is a fine bit of Akaviri craftsmanship. Worn like an amulet, this talisman is said to protect the wearer from poisons of any type. The talisman appears as a snake coiled around and encircling itself. The eyes of the snake are supposed to be precious gems or some such. Through my sources, I've learned that the last reported location of the Draconian Madstone was the ruins at Pale Pass.
If you retrieve the Draconian Madstone for me, I'll be happy to compensate you by rewarding you with another Akaviri artifact. Are you in the game?
Let me tell you how you're going to find the talisman. I've come into the possession of a diary written by an Akaviri messenger. I suspect that the text within can lead you to the ruins. Here's a translation of the passages we could still read. It was quite damaged. I've also included a rough map that was drawn in the diary as well. I'm also providing you with a unique key that was supposedly found with the diary. I'm assuming it will prove useful when you arrive at the site.

items.name: Draconian Madstone
items.description: an Akaviri artifact, an amulet that protects its wearer from poisons of any type, looks like a snake coiled around and encircling itself: the eyes of the snake are precious gems

The Mage Light spell is useful to any mage, not just those specializing in Alteration. Can you cast one on the seal on the ground?

description:
Welcome to this place. I've looked forward to seeing you. I am, as you know, Aran Linvail.
Strange things are afoot on the docks. Shipments are disappearing, as are my employees with them. We are significantly weakened by this. I think it unlikely you would be captured or wooed to the enemy. If you go to the docks and bolster the guard on the shipments, it will strengthen our position.
Go at night, and you will find my present guard captain there already, a woman by the name of Mook. Take note of anything odd that happens.
Good hunting. Report to me if anything happens. Oh, and the reward I have set aside for you... I'll let you have some magical items. You will find them useful, I am sure.

I've been pouring over some of the tomes left here in the keep. Interesting stories, indeed. Seems the previous incarnation of the Dawnguard had, at one time, some interesting toys.
I have located one of their toys. Arkay and I think it could be a great advantage for us. You should look into retrieving it. It is a magical shield that when blocked with, surrounds its wielder with a holy aura that harms the undead. Might come in handy.
You'll be up against the Falmer of Sightless Pit, if I understand Arkay correctly. Nothing you can't handle.

reward.description: a holy sword

tools: the player is a holy knight
Sir Roderic is dead: he was questing for the holy Relics at the Prophet's call with Lathon

Sir Roderic prayed at all the shrines, and received a disturbing vision featuring Sir Berich: Sir Berich had found the Greaves of the Crusader and the Sword of the Crusader, but had then turned to evil
Sir Roderic found the Relics and the wraith of Sir Berich within Sir Berich's tomb: Sir Roderic shouted for Lathon to take the Greaves of the Crusader
Lathon gives the player the Greaves of the Crusader
the wraith of Sir Berich attacked Sir Roderic with the Sword of the Crusader
description:
Sir knight! I have terrible news. Sir Roderic... I think he's dead.
Sir Roderic was a holy knight, like you, questing for the Relics at the Prophet's call. I, Lathon, was his squire. I believed he was chosen by the gods to reclaim the Relics. At first things were going well. He prayed at all the shrines, and received a vision. A disturbing vision. "The shade of Sir Berich spoke to me," was all he said. "We must put him to rest." He said that Sir Berich's tomb was in Underpall Cave -- which is no cave, but some kind of buried keep.
He had learned that Sir Berich had once been a questing knight, like us. He had found the Greaves and Sword of the Crusader, but then turned to evil. Sir Roderic hoped to find the Relics within Sir Berich's tomb. And he did. But we also found a terrible guardian -- the wraith of Sir Berich.
I brought you... Sir Roderic shouted for me to take them... the Greaves of the Crusader. The holy Relic. They're yours. The wraith used the Sword of the Crusader against Sir Roderic. I don't know how that evil thing could use the holy weapon, but it did.
You must avenge Sir Roderic by killing the foul wraith and get yourself the Sword of the Crusader!

characters.name: Sir Roderic
characters.description: a holy knight

characters.name: Sir Berich
characters.description: a questing knight of old

title: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

name: Serve the One God
objective: retrieve an item for the One God
first_tasks: venture below, and retrieve the item

first_task_locations.description: in this area, atop a holy altar

quest_giver.name: Gaal
quest_giver.description: high priest of the One God

reward.description: the player will be added to the ranks of the One God

tools: Gaal will gives the player a key to the inner chambers
the door to the inner chambers is located a short distance back the way the player came, at the sewer passages
description:
I am Gaal, high priest of the One God.
There is... something that you could do that the great one cannot, despite his vast power.
The Unseeing Eye knows of a valuable item in this area.
The item is a rod... or part of a rod, rather, that you will find atop a holy altar. I cannot tell you more than that. You must let your faith guide you.
If you were to venture below, you could prove your worth by retrieving this artifact for him. Do this, and I will allow you into our ranks and the One's divine presence.
I have a key I can give you... This will allow you entrance to the inner chambers through a door a short distance back the way you came, at the sewer passages.

items.description: an artifact, a part of a rod

title: Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn

name: Marlowe's Plea for Help
objective: find out what Marlowe needs help with
first_tasks: talk to Marlowe

first_task_locations.description: Marlowe's home, a simple, safe dwelling atop the east cliff

tools: Marlowe assumes that the player is one of the strangers that all the locals have been talking about, an adventurer from the north
Marlowe and his daughter shall surely perish without the player's help
description:
Excuse me, I... I do not mean to be rude... but you *are* one of the strangers that all the locals have been talking about, aren't you? An adventurer from the north? Yes, yes, of course you are. Anyone can see that you are an extraordinary person. Please forgive me.
I would not bother you, stranger, but I am in terrible peril! I need your aid! I beg you for a boon or I and my daughter both shall surely perish! I... cannot speak more of this here. Please come to my home on top of the cliff, I beg you! We can speak freely there!
My home is atop the east cliff, adventurer. It is a simple dwelling but... safe, for the moment. My name is Marlowe... please meet me there and I shall explain everything, I swear.
title: Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn

name: Kill Roger's Sea Troll
objective: kill the sea troll
first_tasks: find the sea troll

reward.description: gold pieces

tools: NONE
description:
Hmmn. I don't remember seeing you down here before. Me name be Roger.
Oh, the sewers aren't so terrible. The guards don't be comin' down here, and my customers like to be somewhere... out of sight. 'Tis the beasties that are the biggest problem, especially of late. There's this sea troll. People have 'em as pets, and when they grow too large, they huck 'em down here to torment me.
I suppose I could part with a few coins for the deed. I tell you what... dispose of the sea troll beastie for me, an' I'll be pleased to pay you 500 gold pieces, aye?
title: Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn

name: Under the Table
objective: make a delivery for Romlyn Dreth
first_tasks: smuggle a small Black-Briar Mead keg to Wilhelm

reward.description: Wilhelm will trade the player something for the Black-Briar Mead keg

tools: if the player bumps into Indaryn, they should not tell him anything about Romlyn Dreth's dealings
description:
I'm not selling cheap mead. I'm selling good mead for cheap... Black-Briar Mead. I sell cases of it for half of what the inns and taverns pay through the Black-Briar Meadery.
If anyone saw me leave Riften, they'd get suspicious. I need someone to take this small keg of Black-Briar Mead to Wilhelm at the Vilemyr Inn in Ivarstead. Drop it off and he'll trade you something for the delivery. Keep it as payment for the legwork.
Oh, and if you bump into Indaryn from the meadery, keep your mouth shut. He'd rat us out in a second.

characters.description: a male innkeeper

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: Ankheg Culling
objective: kill exactly 4 ankhegs
first_tasks: find 4 ankhegs

reward.description: gold pieces

tools: NONE
description:
I'm Gerde, a ranger.
You've come here to fight ankhegs? Well, listen up: it's mating season, so it's primarily females coming up to the surface, looking to put on a little extra weight. They're hungry, they're aggressive, and there are a lot of them. Now, the point of this exercise is not to exterminate them, but to keep their population to a manageable level. Remember, they aerate the soil and thereby improve crop yields by as much as 15%. Food is going to be scarce enough in the next few years, so keep that in mind when you're out there. No more than four ankhegs per party. After that it's catch and release, all right? Most of the activity starts about fifty yards to the east.
Now move out, everyone. You'll get 75 gold pieces, if you stick to the quota.
title: Baldur's Gate

name: A duel with Shar-Teel Dosan
objective: win duel against Shar-Teel Dosan
first_tasks: select the male party member who shall duel Shar-Teel Dosan

reward.description: Shar-Teel Dosan joins the player's party

tools: the player is the leader of a party of adventurers that has both men and women: Shar-Teel Dosan only duels men
if Shar-Teel Dosan wins the duel the player has to give 20 gold to her
Shar-Teel Dosan will kill anyone who tries to interfere the duel
description:
Hold, traveler! I, Shar-Teel Dosan, challenge your best warrior to a duel. I don't fight women, so only men should step forward.
I win, and you give me 20 gold. In the unlikely event that one of you bests me, I'll pledge my sword to your cause, however stupid it may be..
Will your champion step forward? I only fight men, so your women will have to be satisfied with just watching. Don't entertain any thoughts about cheating. If any of the rest of you try to interfere in this fight, I'll kill them outright.
title: Baldur's Gate

name: Save Pala
objective: save Pala from poisoning
first_tasks: meet Danno in Trademeet

quest_giver.name: Danno
quest_giver.description: a distressed man who knows the player

tools: Danno bought a love potion from Wallace at the market square: Danno gave Pala the love potion
Pala drank the love potion and collapsed
description:
Oh, Mazzy! Thank the gods that I've found you! I've hurt Pala!
You have to save her! I didn't mean to do it. I bought a love potion from Wallace the peddler at the market square. I just wanted her to love me. She only had a sip of it, and she collapsed.
She is with your mother, Mazzy. How was I to know it was poison? Oh, please hurry! I will meet you in Trademeet.

name: A Mansion of Marauders
objective: confirm whether the Dark Hall actually exists
first_tasks: scout out Darkwood

first_task_locations.name: Darkwood
first_task_locations.description: a dark, dense forest with thick leaf canopies that block sunlight

reward.description: a block of emerald

tools: NONE
description:
I think I saw an Illager scout keeping an eye on our village from the shadows of nearby trees. Pineville is not safe! The Illagers of the Dark Hall are going to kill us all!
Traveler, could you please help me calm my nerves? It is said that there is a woodland mansion called the Dark Hall deep in the thickets of Darkwood. It is supposed to be a safe haven for Illagers, those bloodthirsty outcasts who resorted to banditry!
I would like you to scout out Darkwood. Be cautious. Darkwood is a dark, dense forest with thick leaf canopies that block sunlight: perfect for ambushes. Find out if the Dark Hall truly exists. I'll pay you a block of emerald! Those are not that easy to come by!

groups.name: Illagers
groups.description: outcasts from villages that became bandits

title: Minecraft

name: Assistant Cartographer
objective: give the map of Spruced Hills to Carl
first_tasks: make a map of Spruced Hills

reward.description: a spyglass

tools: the player is a friend of Carl
description:
I raise my face from my maps for a moment, and there you are! Just as I need the help of a trusted friend.
There are many, many regions in this world: mapping them all out is a tremendous task. I ask you to map out one of them: Spruced Hills. It is a taiga hills region, which means that there might be some rather steep hills covered in spruces and snow.
After making a map of Spruced Hills, come back here and give the map to me. I shall give you a spyglass, a fine tool for an aspiring cartographer.
Travel safely! Being mindful of your surroundings is an important skill for everyone, not just us cartographers.

Marius Caro, by grace of the Gods, Count of Leyawiin. You are a stranger to me, but well-met. Perhaps you would like to do a service for Leyawiin?
I need your help. An Orc named Mazoga here claims to be a knight, but will not reveal her business. Find out why she is here, and report to me, and you will earn a reward suitable for those who serve Leyawiin.

quest_giver.name: Officer Vai
quest_giver.description: an officer of the Flaming Fist

reward.description: gold pieces per bandit scalp

tools: the bandits are working for someone
description:
I am Officer Vai of the Flaming Fist and, to be honest, I could use your help.
The bandit raids have been getting worse. I used to think that they were just your usual brigands out to make a quick buck in troubled times, but not anymore. They're working for someone... Damn it, this is a fine mess, isn't it?
I'll pay 50 gold pieces for every bandit scalp you can bring me — and spread the news. I want this whole region cleared, and I want to know what in the Nine Hells is going on here.

groups.description: a mercenary organization promoting order and law

title: Baldur's Gate

name: Old Friends
objective: find the person who summoned ash spawns and made them attack Neloth
first_tasks: wear the ring Neloth gave you to find the source of the ash spawns
tools: Neloth gives the player a ring: it will light up the source of the ash spawn attacks when the player gets close to it
description:
I'm under attack. There are too many coincidences. There must be someone behind all of my recent troubles.
I have enemies. Legions of them back in Morrowind. However, in this case I have reason to believe it is someone in Solstheim. First I need to identify the culprit. I've enchanted this ring to find the source of the attacks. Here, take it.
Just wear the ring I gave you. It will light up the source when you get close to it. I enchanted the ring with a bit of ash from the last ash spawn attack. It can follow the magical link back to its summoner.

locations.name: Morrowind
locations.description: a province where Neloth has made many enemies

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: Gain the services of Sir Sarles for the Temple of Talos
objective: convince Sir Sarles to create a work of art for the temple of Talos
first_tasks: find Sir Sarles
tools: Sir Sarles demands illithium as his art medium
if the player sees the representatives of the other churches, the player must kill them
description:
I, Talon Yarryl, priest of Talos, have a mission for you!
Talos demands proper tribute, and that occasionally means artwork pleasing to the eye. If a piece of his fury can be represented, more might see and fear it.
An artist visits Athkatla now. The artist travels under the name Sir Sarles, though it is surely a fake. He is pretentious, demanding, and very good.
We must command a commission from him. But he is not being cooperative. His commission is outlandish, and he demands illithium as his medium! He may as well have asked for dragon tears.
Convince him to work for Talos. Use whatever means you must. Other churches are trying the same... if you cross their representatives, kill them.
Incur what debts you must, and use force where it will help. Stop at nothing. This man must realize there is no choice but to work in the service of Talos.

characters.name: Sir Sarles
characters.description: a good artist who is also a pretentious and demanding man

characters.name: Talos
characters.description: the evil god of thunder and destruction

title: Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn

name: Boethiah's Calling
objective: get a glimpse of Boethiah
first_tasks: gain someone's trust, lead him to the shrine above, instruct him to touch the pillar of sacrifice to trap him, and kill him with the ceremonial blade

reward.description: Boethiah will appear before the player

tools: NONE
description:
We are forged by Boethiah's example. We carve our will upon the world through our tongues and our blades. You? You are nothing. An empty vapor, dispersed by the slightest breeze.
If you desire a glimpse of Boethiah, our Dark Mistress, then this is what you must do. First, prove your tongue can wield a lie. Find someone. Gain his trust. Lead him to the shrine above. Next, instruct your thrall to touch the Pillar of Sacrifice. Its magic will ensnare him, rendering him helpless. Then, girded with certitude, plant the ceremonial blade deeply, so that the waters of his heart wash over you.
If your will is strong enough, it will stir Boethiah in her Dark Mansion, and she will appear before us.

characters.name: Boethiah
characters.description: the lady of plots and the dark warrior, an evil goddess

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: Prophet of the Night
objective: locate a Moth Priest for Lord Harkon
first_tasks: speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers and travelers about the rumors of a Moth Priest in Skyrim
tools: Lord Harkon is giving a speech to the player and their fellow vampires: the player and the other vampires will dominate over the sun itself, and forge a realm of eternal darkness
Lord Harkon has reclaimed one of his Elder Scrolls and needs a Moth Priest to read it
description:
Scions of the night! Hear my words! The prophesied time is at last upon us. Soon we will claim dominion over the sun itself, and forge a new realm of eternal darkness.
Now that I have reclaimed one of my Elder Scrolls, we must find a Moth Priest to read it. I have spread false rumors about the discovery of an Elder Scroll in Skyrim to lure a Moth Priest here. Now it is time to see if those efforts have borne fruit.
Go forth, and search the land for rumors of a Moth Priest within our borders. Look to the cities. Speak to innkeepers, carriage drivers, anyone who would meet a traveler.
Go now, and carry out this task. This is my command!

items.name: Elder Scrolls
items.description: mysterious scrolls used in divining prophecies

characters.name: Moth Priest
characters.description: a priest who has dedicated his whole life to reading and deciphering Elder Scrolls

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: Go Fish
objective: bring 12 slaughterfish scales to Aelwin Merowald
first_tasks: kill slaughterfish and collect their scales

reward.description: Aelwin Merowald makes it worth the player's time

tools: slaughterfish nearly took off Aelwin Merowald's leg
Aelwin Merowald could retire with the money he would get from the slaughterfish scales
description:
You know, stranger, there comes a time in every man's life when he has to admit that he's lost the fight.
Well, I've fought and I've lost. Who did I lose to? Who is my great enemy? Well, don't laugh... it's a bunch of damn fish.
I'm a fisherman. Or at least, I was. Until one of those slaughterfish damn near took my leg off. I was collecting their scales, see. I had a contract with this young alchemist. You wouldn't believe what he was paying for those scales! Then last month, one of the bastards got ahold of my leg. Took me right out of the business. But this alchemist, he needs the scales right away. The alchemist was paying so much for the scales that I'm close to having enough saved so that I can retire. But now, I can't get out there to Lake Rumare -- not with this leg. I only needed twelve more scales! Can you believe it? I was so close!
I've picked up a few things in my travels. If you head out there and bring me back the twelve scales that I need, I can make it worth your time. Help an old fisherman out, won't you?
title: The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion

objective: recover "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane" for John
first_tasks: find "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane"

reward.description: enchanted book

tools: the player is a famous hero
description:
To have more tomes in my library... Now that would be incredibly lovely...
Oh hero, I was just dreaming about having more precious, amazing books. Actually, you could recover a book for me. It is called "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane", and it tells about the hellish dimension your familiar with. You can find it in a nearby mineshaft.
I'm willing to part from an enchanted book, should you succeed in recovering "The Nether: Compiled Accounts of the Hellish Plane".

title: Minecraft

name: Ancient Artisanship
objective: bring an ancient device to Zed
first_tasks: find the ancient device

first_task_locations.name: Tut's Temple
first_task_locations.description: an ancient desert pyramid filled with traps and treasure, a short way away from Desert Refuge

reward.description: something useful

tools: NONE
description:
Hello traveler. What brings you to Desert Refuge, this piece of civilization out in the scorching desert? Are you stocking up on supplies on your way to explore desert ruins?
If you are, I would like your help. I promise to pay you with something useful. The thing is, there's this ancient pyramid, Tut's Temple, a short way away from this village. It is said to be full of treasure! And some highly lethal traps that are too much to overcome for a meager researcher like me. There are also rumors that say that the ancients had useful devices lost to time. I'd love to get my hands on one, for science.
Please, go to Tut's Temple and find an ancient device! It may tell us about many lost crafts!
title: Minecraft

name: Azani Blackheart
objective: help Modryn Oreyn prove that the Blackwood Company lied about completing a contract for Argoth
first_tasks: meet up with Modryn Oreyn
investigate Arpenia with Modryn Oreyn

quest_giver.name: Modryn Oreyn
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Fighters Guild

tools: Modryn Oreyn has been investigating the Blackwood Company: they are a danger to the Fighters Guild
the Fighters Guild was contracted by Argoth to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart: Modryn Oreyn went in there with twenty good men, and left with five
Vitellus Donton was not one of the survivors: he died while covering the Fighters Guild members' retreat
Argoth is dead and the artifact is gone after the Blackwood Company supposedly finished the contract instead of the Fighters Guild
Vilena Donton is not going to know about this mission: it's the player's choice to accept the mission
description:
Good. You're here. We've got duties to attend to.
I've been looking into the Blackwood Company. Heard some disturbing things. We know they're a danger to us. And we know they're good at what they do.
I've heard stories, but nothing I can prove is true. Maybe they've got a mage working with them. Maybe they're just well trained. All I know for sure is that they'll accept any contract, and they'll do anything to complete it. And they don't care who gets in the way.
We were contracted by a wizard, Argoth, to recover an artifact from Azani Blackheart, a ruthless bandit leader. I went in there with twenty men. I left with five. Vitellus Donton wasn't one of them. He died covering our retreat. I snooped around. Apparently, the Blackwood Company completed that contract for us. I went in there with twenty good men. I can't believe that bunch finished the job. There's more. Argoth -- he's dead, the artifact gone. Sounds like a set-up. Maybe they made a deal with Blackheart. I don't know. But I'll find out.
Now we find out what really happened. And we let it be known. I want to show the people who the Blackwood Company really are. I can't order you do this with me. It's dangerous, and Vilena Donton isn't going to know about it. It's your choice.
If you accept this mission, we leave as soon as you're ready. I want to investigate Blackheart's stronghold at Arpenia. Meet me at the Leyawiin guild hall. We'll go from there.

first_tasks: find and follow the suspicious person at dusk

reward.description: a diamond

tools: the player is a famous hero
description:
I almost didn't see you there, Hero. I'm succumbed in deep, dark thoughts at the moment.
Someone's been spying on our village for quite some time. I personally spotted that suspicious individual coming here around dusk.
Perhaps that person is plotting something malicious, perhaps not. Regardless, I'm worried that something bad might happen to Cocoa Hamlet. You, Hero, are the right person to find out what that suspicious person is up to. The jungle can hide many dangers in its deep thickets of trees and vines. Find and follow the suspicious person, here in Cocoa Hamlet.
We can give you a diamond for your time. An adventurer found it in an abandoned jungle temple a long time ago.
title: Minecraft

description:
Pleasure to meet you. The name's Cordyr.
I'm from down south, where the Cloud Peaks tumble into the sea. A pair of sirines has been trying to move into the area. They sank my fishing boat and put me right out of work. *sigh* If they weren't so dang beautiful, it would be a lot easier to convince people of how much of a nuisance they can be. Can you kill them for me? It's a dirty deed but it's the cost of civilization, isn't it?
You can have a haste scroll as payment.
title: Baldur's Gate

quest_giver.description: a fellow thief, and Vald's ex-lover

description:
Vald? That pig? Oh, I have info on him. More than you care to know. Vald does not have a good side. The only thing he understands is gold. A man after my own heart.
You can try to buy him off, but he'll ask for a whole lot. I mean, you are asking him to betray Mercer Frey. Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.
Of course, you could just run him through and take what you need off of his corpse... I could care less.

description:
Now I ask for a more specific task that will disrupt the Shadow Thieves further.
The task is... unseemly.
It calls for the murder of a man. Not a truly innocent man, but hardly a villain of epic scope. You must kill, blaming the murder on the Shadow Thieves. He is head of a merchant house, and his link to Shadow Thieves is blatant. If he were to die and certain gear were at the scene, it would implicate the guild we oppose.
Take this cloak and dagger, and go kill Senior Armagaran Vulova. When he is dead, put the cloak and dagger in the fountain in his house. He will die easily, though there may be guards. His small house is in the Government District, between the jail and the government building.
Go.

name: Smithing Training

first_tasks: find a book about Hazadir to find the answer

reward.description: smithing training from Gin-Wulm

tools: the player asked smithing training from Gin-Wulm
description:
Mighty bold of you, asking for smithing training. What makes you think you're worth my time?
I bet you don't know the first thing about smithing. Have you read up on the history of the craft? I doubt it. You answer a simple question, and I'll think about training you.
So here it is: What does the name Hazadir mean to you? Few recognize the name anymore, even though he was famous.
Had a book written about him, in fact! I don't have a copy myself, but there was one in First Edition last time I was browsing there. At least some people take an interest in history.

characters.name: Hazadir
characters.description: a famous man related to the history of smithing

name: The Jagged Crown
objective: find the Jagged Crown for Ulfric

tools: the High King always wore the Jagged Crown: the Jagged Crown is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it
description:
I've found the final resting place of the Jagged Crown. Can you believe it? Well, I'm almost certain.
The High King always wore the Jagged Crown. It was the symbol of his might and power. The crown is made from the bones and teeth of ancient dragons, and it is said to contain a portion of the power of every king who has worn it. True or not, who would dare deny Ulfric's claim, when the legendary Jagged Crown sits upon his brow?
We're headed to Korvanjund. But, if old King Borgas is indeed buried there, we're bound to run into trouble of some kind. Your fellow Stormcloaks are already assembling outside the tomb. I'll meet you there as soon as I'm finished up here.

objective: prevent the Ezrohir from interrogating Commander Muzaffar

tools: the Ezrohir are preparing to assault Zeryphesh
description:
Greetings, my friend! Welcome to Zeryphesh! I am Malik Vosh. I speak for the Zeraphi.
As you know, the Ezrohir are preparing to assault our city. Our military leader, Commander Muzaffar, has apparently been captured by the Ezrohir, out in the Ossean Wastes. They'll have sent for soldiers to take their prisoners back to their stronghold. Once they get him to Riftkeep, they'll identify him quickly enough, and then they'll interrogate him until they know everything about our defenses.
I believe you're going out to the Ossean Wastes, the vast desert. Please, rescue Muzaffar. We need him.

title: Torchlight II

name: Blood's Honor
objective: claim the head of a Glenmoril Witch so that Kodlak Whitemane can cure the Companions' lycanthropy
first_tasks: seek out the Glenmoril witches, kill them, and collect their heads

quest_giver.name: Kodlak Whitemane
quest_giver.description: the player's guildleader in the Companions, and a Nord who wants to end up in Sovngarde

tools: the Companions are nearly five thousand years old: the Companions became werewolves a few hundred years ago when the Glenmoril witches promised to grant the Companions great power in exchange for hunting their lord Hircine
the Companions were deceived: lycanthropy affects not just the Companions' bodies, but the Companions' spirits as well
description:
Have you heard the story of how we came to be werewolves?
The Companions are nearly five thousand years old. This matter of beastblood has only troubled us for a few hundred. One of my predecessors was a good, but short-sighted man. He made a bargain with the witches of Glenmoril Coven. If the Companions would hunt in the name of their lord, Hircine, we would be granted great power.
The Companions of old became werewolves. They did not believe the change would be permanent. The witches offered payment, like anyone else. But we had been deceived. The disease, you see, affects not just our bodies. It seeps into the spirit. Upon death, werewolves are claimed by Hircine for his Hunting Grounds. For some, this is a paradise. They want nothing more than to chase prey with their master for eternity. And that is their choice. But I am still a true Nord. And I wish for Sovngarde as my spirit home.
I've spent my twilight years trying to find a cure myself. And now I've found the answer. The witches' magic ensnared us, and only their magic can release us. They won't give it willingly, but we can extract their foul powers by force. I want you to seek them out. Go to their coven in the wilderness. Strike them down as a true warrior of the wild. And bring me their heads. The seat of their abilities. From there, we may begin to undo centuries of impurity.

characters.name: Hircine
characters.description: the god of the werewolves, claims dead werewolves in the Hunting Grounds

groups.name: Companions
groups.description: a band of honorable warriors cursed with lycanthropy

locations.name: Sovngarde
locations.description: the storied afterlife of heroic Nords

locations.name: Hunting Grounds
locations.description: Hircine's realm, a place where the player can hunt forever

name: Peryite's Foolish Followers
objective: rescue the souls of Peryite's worshipers from Oblivion

quest_giver.name: Peryite
quest_giver.description: the lord of natural order, one of the Daedric Princes

reward.name: Spell Breaker
reward.description: a shield

tools: the player has found Peryite's shrine that is filled with Peryite's paralyzed followers: Peryite's worshipers cast a spell in the hopes of summoning Peryite and got trapped between worlds
Peryite will transport the player to the plane of Oblivion in which his worshipers are trapped: when the player has collected the worshipers' souls, Peryite will return the player here
description:
This one moves! A welcome change. So, mortal, you have found my shrine, and you have seen my followers. They are an embarrassment to me, Peryite.
The fools cast a spell in the hopes of summoning me to them. It was prideful and foolish, and it has had its consequences. My followers are trapped between worlds; their bodies here on this plane, their souls in Oblivion. I would have you reunite the bodies and the souls.
I will transport you to the plane of Oblivion in which they are trapped. Find their souls. When all are collected, I will return you here.
You shall have Spell Breaker, with my blessing. May it bring you order.

objective: assassinate Baenlin by staging an accident

quest_giver.name: Vicente Valtieri
quest_giver.description: the player's superior in the Dark Brotherhood

reward.description: a bonus if the player kills Baenlin in the manner specified without killing Gromm

tools: On the second floor of Baenlin's house is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace containing the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair: if the player loosens the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, the head will fall on Baenlin
description:
We need you to stage an... accident. Kill the target in the manner specified, and you'll receive a considerable bonus. The target is a Wood Elf named Baenlin. You will find him at his home in Bruma.
Enter secretly and avoid his manservant, Gromm. On the second floor is a secreted door leading to a crawlspace. Inside are the fastenings of a mounted head that hangs over Baenlin's favorite chair. Loosen the fastenings any night between 8:00 pm and 11:00 pm, and the head will surely fall on Baenlin as he relaxes in his chair, as is custom. If Baenlin is killed in any other manner, or if the manservant Gromm is killed, you will forfeit the bonus.
Now go, and may Death be with you.

description:
Greetings, I am known as Dawnbringer Sain, a priest of Lathander.
I am charged with the acquisition of art for the temple. The beauty of the dawn must be captured in every nook and cranny of Lathander's home.
Athkatla is blessed with the presence of perhaps the greatest sculptor of our age. The artist is known as Sir Sarles, and he is making an all too brief visit. We would be foolish not to seize upon the opportunity to have him work for us.
I would ask you to convince Sir Sarles that it would be best for him to work for us. Go to him now.
Sir Sarles is staying at the Jysstev estate. It is in the southeast section of the Government District.
Remember, you speak for Lathander in this matter.

title: Baldur's Gate II: Shadows of Amn

name: The Path of the Righteous
objective: retrieve the Mace of Zenithar for yourself
first_tasks: complete the challenge of Zenithar

first_task_locations.description: a shrine to Saint Kaladas, below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin

reward.name: Mace of Zenithar
reward.description: a holy mace

tools: the player has passed the gauntlet unlike others in three hundred years: the player can redeem the souls of the ghost knights and restore their order
Sir Ralvas placed his own will and lust for fame over the will of the Nine
Sir Ralvas failed the challenge of Zenithar: the inscription for the challenge says to "walk in the faith"
the player must pray at the shrine of Saint Kaladas to receive a vision: the player will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from them by a great chasm
Sir Ralvas fell from the platform each time he tried to cross the chasm
description:
You have my, Sir Ralvas', tribute, sir knight. In three hundred years, none have passed the gauntlet. In three hundred years, we have never known hope. But for the first time, it seems that someone may succeed where we have failed. I see in you the chance to redeem our souls and restore the order. And now, I must ask you to press forward where I could not. I must ask you to face the challenge of Zenithar.
I was arrogant and foolhardy. I sought personal glory. I placed my own will and my own lust for fame over the will of the Nine. In facing the challenge of Zenithar, I failed. I tried dozens -- no, hundreds of times to reach the Mace. I fell each time. And each time I awoke in the chapel, I leaped again. I tried to enlist the help of the other knights, but none would come to my aid. The inscription says to "walk in the faith" but even now, I do not know what this means.
Below the Chapel of Zenithar in Leyawiin there is a shrine to the great craftsman, Saint Kaladas. Those seeking the Mace must pray before the shrine. When you bow, you will receive a vision -- or perhaps not. It is unclear. The priests saw that my body never moved, but it felt so real. You will see the Mace of Zenithar, separated from you by a great chasm. The chasm represents your doubt. Your faith must be your guide across it.
This is what I know. As I said, my faith was weak. I did not understand the test and I fell from the platform each time I tried to cross. I have told you all that I know. All that is left is for you to prove yourself more worthy than I. If you seek the Mace, travel to Leyawiin's chapel, kneel at the shrine in the undercroft, and let your faith in the Nine be the salvation of us all.

characters.name: Zenithar
characters.description: the god of work and commerce, one of the Nine

characters.name: Saint Kaladas
characters.description: a long-dead saint

title: Fallout 2

name: Forbidden Legend
objective: investigate the forgotten legend of Gauldur, and find the 3 pieces of the Gauldur Amulet
first_tasks: find Mikrul's amulet piece
find Jyrik's amulet piece
find Sigdis' amulet piece

first_task_locations.name: Folgunthur
first_task_locations.description: the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude

quest_giver.name: Daynas Valen
quest_giver.description: a historian, giving quest via "Daynas Valen's Notes"

reward.name: Gauldur Amulet
reward.description: a powerful amulet that belonged to Archmage Gauldur

tools: the Gauldur name wiped out from the annals of history
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis lusted after Archmage Gauldur's power and prestige: they discovered Archmage Gauldur's source of power, the Gauldur Amulet
Archmage Gauldur was murdered by his sons Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis: they split the Gauldur Amulet between them
Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis laid waste to surrounding villages: the high king sent Archmage Geirmund and his battlemages after Mikrul, Jyrik, and Sigdis
description:
Daynas Valen's Notes
by Daynas Valen

How to summarize a lifetime of research? So little of what I have learned matters now - the petty politics of ancient times, the age-long campaign to wipe out all mention of the Gauldur name.
In the opening days of the First Era, the Archmage Gauldur was revered throughout the north. Wisdom, wealth, honor, and power were his, and even the legendary heros' heirs sought his counsel.
Smothered by his shadow, Gauldur's three sons grew cruel and resentful. They lusted after their father's power and prestige, and eventually Jyrik, the eldest, discovered its source: a mysterious amulet, from which he never parted. Together, they conspired to murder their father in his sleep and divide his amulet between them. And so it was done.
Consumed by their newfound power, the brothers laid waste to the surrounding villages. So great was the carnage that the High King himself intervened, sending a company of battlemages led by the Archmage Geirmund to subdue the brothers. And after a devastating battle, the three fled the field.
Mikrul, the youngest, was run to ground in Folgunthur, the ancient barrows at the foot of Solitude. Geirmund pursued Jyrik to the shattered crypts of Saarthal, half-buried even then. And at last, Sigdis was cornered in the southernmost reaches of land and later entombed in Geirmund's Hall.

characters.description: a man revered throughout the north for his wisdom, wealth, honor, and power, who lived during the first era

name: A Venerable Vintage
objective: bring the Shadowbanish Wine to Nerussa
first_tasks: find 6 bottles of Shadowbanish Wine

first_task_locations.description: the many military fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil

reward.description: gold

tools: NONE
description:
Greetings. I'm Nerussa. I'm quite fond of collecting all manners of wines from all over Tamriel. But one vintage continues to elude me: Shadowbanish Wine. How I'd love to add it to my collection.
Apparently the wine is so rare because it was only made in one tiny batch. It's the product of an alchemist who was also a vintner. Besides tasting incredible, the magic within the wine allows the imbiber to be gifted with Night Eye! The vintner made it special for the Legion soldiers posted at the forts when they were active long ago. It was perfect for keeping lookouts warm on cold nights and helping them see better in the dark.
If you can retrieve six bottles of Shadowbanish Wine, I'll gladly pay you well: 1,000 gold. All I know about them is that they're found in the many fort ruins scattered all over Cyrodiil.

name: Dragonhide
objective: help Tolfdir finish his research on the Dragonhide
first_tasks: retrieve Kahvozein's Fang, and use it to carve a few heartscales off a dead dragon

reward.description: the first copy of the Dragonhide tome

tools: NONE
description:
I've been working on something. An improvement on the Ebonyflesh spell. I've made progress, but then hit a snag. I think perhaps you could help.
I made some progress using the essence of dragon scales. But they're just not quite potent enough. My knowledge of history is far from complete, but I did some research and discovered two things.
First, there are ancient references to dragon "heartscales". What little I could learn suggests they may be what I need. Second, there are stories of a dagger called Kahvozein's Fang, said to be sharp enough to carve heartscales off a dragon.
First you'll need to retrieve the dagger, then use it to carve a few heartscales off a dragon. Presumably a deceased one.
If my research succeeds, I certainly think you deserve the first copy of the Dragonhide spell tome.

items.description: a protection spell, an improvement on the Ebonyflesh spell

description:
Ah, dear friend, may I steal a moment of your time? I have a rather delicate situation I was hoping you could help me with. This is a personal matter, and will have no bearing on your standing within the Dark Brotherhood. Would you like to hear more?
Now, the details. Far south of here, on the southern end of Cyrodiil, lies a swamp called Bogwater. Hiding in that swamp you will find an Argonian Shadowscale named Scar-Tail. Kill this renegade. and bring me his heart as proof of the deed.
I have some history with Scar-Tail. When Ocheeva and I trained with the Dark Brotherhood as children, we befriended another initiate, a Shadowscale by the name of Scar-Tail. The three of us were inseparable. When our training was completed, we reluctantly parted ways. But now... Now, the unthinkable has happened! Scar-Tail has fled Black Marsh and refuses to fulfill his duties as royal assassin! This is an act of treason! This treachery must be punished! Just as a member of the Dark Brotherhood cannot kill a fellow family member, a Shadowscale is forbidden from slaying another Shadowscale. That is why you must go to Bogwater and eliminate that treacherous snake!
Please kill Scar-Tail, so Ocheeva and I can put this matter behind us.

characters.name: Scar-Tail
characters.description: an Argonian Shadowscale, Ocheeva and Teinaava's childhood friend, and a royal assassin of Black Marsh who escaped his duties

reward.description: equipment fit for a hero

tools: the player has helped Estherians before
description:
You must be the human the other Estherians are speaking of. I am glad to have met you. I have been sent on a quest to recover the Scroll of Anom-Irek, stored in a vault in the Corrupted Crypt, here. The scroll should allow us to heal the Estherians who have been corrupted by evil spirits. Unfortunately, the Sturmbeorn have already entered the crypt, and I have been unable to get past them.
Can I ask you to attempt to retrieve the scroll? I will wait here in the Path of the Honored Dead for your return. Should you succeed, I will see what I can do to provide you with some equipment more fitting a hero of your stature.

Falkreath is known for its graveyard, traveler. We've buried more dead than you can imagine.
I just finished giving my old war companion, Berit, a proper burial by fire. Old hard head hated the idea of being lost cold in the ground.
Could you deliver the ashes to Runil, the priest of Arkay? He'll know the right blessings to make for Berit's soul.
