description:
Some incredibly foolish individual's been throwing Ender Pearls all over our village! Now the whole place is crawling with Endermites!
Could you take care of those little critters before they cause any serious issues? Kill them all, and receive 16 golden carrots for your trouble. You would have all our thanks, too.
title: Minecraft

name: Lost Legacy
objective: protect Tharstan while he researches an old tomb
first_tasks: meet Tharstan

reward.description: Tharstan will pay the player

tools: the passage to Vahlok's Tomb must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions
description:
Yes, I think you're just the adventurous sort I need. I have a job offer for you.
As a scholar of history, I've always found Solstheim to be most intriguing. I've made many forays into the ancient ruins that cover the island. I've come to know those ruins so well, I could draw you a map from memory. That's why I noticed the new passage the moment I laid eyes on it.
it leads to an old tomb, I think. It must have been opened by an earthquake that accompanied one of the Red Mountain's eruptions. I'd love to have a closer look, but those old ruins can be dangerous and I'm no adventurer. I'll pay you to watch my back down there.
I'll be heading back there soon. If you're interested, meet me at the ruins and we'll see what we can find. Now I'm off to pack for the expedition!

locations.name: Solstheim
locations.description: an island that is covered with ancient ruins

title: The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim

name: Filial Bonds
objective: find Torkild
first_tasks: see if Torkild is with the werebears of the glacier

quest_giver.name: Wulf Wild-Blood
quest_giver.description: a hunter, and a worried brother

tools: Torkild may have become a werebear: a bear-like cursed creature
description:
In days past, my brother Torkild and I would share the hunt, but that was... long ago.
Torkild had a wild gleam in his eye, more than most. In my darkest times, I fear he fell in among the werebears of the glacier.
Werebears are twisted, cursed beasts. True bears are noble and great creatures of the wild. I've heard tell of men who, by curse or by heart's desire, become transformed into one of those vile things. It is a pitiable fate. And one that I fear has fallen to my brother.
If you happen to cross his path, be wary. He was a fierce warrior as a man. If he fell prey to his more bestial side, he could be deadly.

characters.name: Torkild
characters.description: Wulf Wild-Blood's brother, a wild man and a fearsome warrior

first_tasks: enter Ragefast's house

reward.description: an enchanted item

tools: Ragefast imprisoned Ragefast's nymph in Ragefast's house
description:
Greetings to you and yours, my friend. I'm Ramazith.
Might I have your ear a moment? My proposition is thus: I would have you enter into the home of a colleague of mine and effect the release of a creature he has imprisoned there. Ragefast be his name, and he has in his possession one of the most beautiful and useful creatures in all of Faerûn. It's a nymph he captured some time ago, and I know not what laughable plans he has for her, but I am sure she be more... productive in my care.
I not so rich as to be able to offer huge gold, but as competent wizard I do have the odd magical item of worth. Perhaps an enchanted item will serve your needs, no?

characters.name: Ragefast
characters.description: a male wizard
Ragefast's nymph, a female nymph, one of the most beautiful and useful creatures in Faerûn

title: Baldur's Gate

name: Two Sides of the Coin
objective: find out where Jorundr and Arnora Auria's stolen gold is hidden
first_tasks: speak to Jorundr

reward.description: Arnora Auria will split the stolen gold between the player and herself

tools: Jorundr and Arnora Auria have had a rocky relationship: Jorundr and Arnora Auria committed petty crimes all over Cyrodiil
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets
Arnora Auria got afraid of Jorundr

Jorundr and Arnora Auria's last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City: Jorundr killed a guard and he was captured by the Bruma guard two days later at Jorundr and Arnora Auria's makeshift campsite
Jorundr had moved the stolen gold away from the campsite
description:
Here's the deal. Jorundr and I have had a rocky relationship at best.
Against my will, I've been dragged all over Cyrodiil helping him commit petty crimes. I wouldn't say we're thieves. I mean, we've stolen things... sure. But we've never stolen that much at one time. Just enough to keep us going. That is, until last year.
Jorundr started to take risks and began robbing more dangerous targets. Not just lone merchants, mind you. I'm talking about the bigger scores. Like estates and tax shipments. I begged him to stop, as I knew that his capers would one day lead to violence. He just threatened to... hurt me if I got in his way. I think the gold changed him. I really do. He wasn't the man I met seven years ago. The few times I tried to say something, he'd strike me or push me away. I began to become frightened of him.
Our last score was a tax shipment being delivered to the Imperial City. We robbed it, and in the midst of the chaos, Jorundr killed a guard. I was mortified. We snatched up the gold and holed up in the mountains. He said if I breathed a word of the murder to anyone, he'd kill me. I was terrified of him at this point. Two days later, the Bruma City Guard traced us to our makeshift campsite. I was off gathering food, but Jorundr was captured. Served him right. When I went back to the site later, the gold was gone! He'd moved it! What I need you to do is go to the Bruma Castle Dungeons and speak to him for me. Convince him to tell you where the gold is and then we split it.

characters.name: Jorundr
characters.description: a male thief, and Arnora Auria's ex-boyfriend
